programme.title: Timeless
programme.desc: US sci-fi drama series. The team travel back to New York City in 1919, where they partner with pioneering detective Grace Humiston to help Alice Paul, a leading figure in the women's suffrage movement, who has been framed for murder by Rittenhouse.(n)

programme.title: Timeless
programme.desc: US sci-fi drama series. The team visit Washington DC in 1981 on the day President Reagan was shot, only to discover that the sleeper agent's target is actually a young Agent Christopher.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international news live via satellite.(n)

programme.desc: Presenters tell a new story each day. Some of the best loved fairytales as well as a host of original stories are performed with props, graphics and colourful costumes.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Popular preschool animated series about a lovable piglet and her family. Madame Gazelle takes the whole class to London for the day where they are given a tour by the Queen herself!(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Animated series about a lovable piglet and her family. Madame Gazelle sets the children a creative task - making masks. There are carrot masks, robot masks, and even pretty butterfly masks... The only thing missing is lots and lots of glitter!(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Animated antics of a lovable piglet and her family. A new synthesiser arrives for Daddy Pig, and his family collect sounds for it from around the house while he is out at work. Later, when he starts to play, it makes some very funny music - full of oinks, pings and even a flushing toilet!(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Children's animation series following a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: CGI-animated series about a pack of heroic puppies who work on rescue missions in Adventure Bay. The PAW Patrol team needs to get a sleepwalking bear back home before he wakes up.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kids
programme.desc: Children's wildlife show. Wild Kids Mia, Roxanne and Alex join presenters Kealan and Ciara to explore the sea, sand and rocky shoreline.(n)

programme.title: Bitz and Bob
programme.desc: Preschool series following the animated antics of eight-year-old inventor and creator Bitz and her younger brother Bob.(n)

programme.title: Peek Zoo
programme.desc: Children's show. It's a special day at Peek Zoo, when visitors gather to watch the flamingos dance to attract a mate.(n)

programme.title: Dream Street
programme.desc: Animated adventures of Buddy the breakdown truck and his friends in Dream Street - where toys and treats come to life.(n)

programme.title: Living With a Fairy
programme.desc: Children's show. Fairy catches a cold, and her magic gets all in a muddle, so Jay finds a spell in the Fairy Medical Book to make her better.(n)

programme.title: Nina and the Neurons: Earth Explorers
programme.desc: Preschool science show. Super scientist Nina and her young explorers travel the world in search of the Earth's natural wonders. Nina investigates how people find out about other planets - with the help of all her sense neurons. Explorers Nomi and Oliver visit Nina in her workshop and discover that remote control vehicles can be sent to other planets. Next they visit a Mars Rover and they find out why it has to be able to see for itself when it is on Mars.(n)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: A reality-style drama following the lives of a group of dancers at the Next Step Dance Studio as they attempt to win the regional dance championships. Now that Emily is gone, the dancers decide to change the regionals routine, adding a duet for Michelle and Eldon. James returns to A-Troupe and holds Riley to her promise of going on a date with him.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve continues his deadly journey through the southern states of the USA and goes fishin' Texan style and discovers they sure make 'em big. The alligator gar is the largest fresh water fish in North America but nothing can prepare Steve for the near record-breaking seven foot prehistoric monster he reels in. Next Steve investigates a destructive force of nature - the tornado. To simulate their 200 miles per hour deadly winds, the crew fire up the engines of a fighter jet. Standing in the jet flow Steve shows how everyday objects can transform into deadly projectiles. Finally Steve heads south to the swamps of Georgia in search of a huge alligator snapping turtle, and in true Deadly style the crew soon find themselves wading through snake infested waters and surrounded by highly venomous cottonmouth snakes.(n)

programme.title: Sadie J
programme.desc: Feel-good comedy about a feisty 13-year-old girl with the sass of Cheryl Cole and the punch of a prize fighter. When Steve tries to make Sadie spend Mother's Day with his new girlfriend, Sadie goes on a campaign to get rid of her.(n)

programme.title: Nicky, Ricky, Dicky & Dawn
programme.desc: Sitcom about quadruplets who battle sibling rivalry at every turn. The Quads get detention and have to miss the school carnival.(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found Music Studios
programme.desc: Reality-style series following the members of an exclusive after-school music programme. The girls' band holds auditions to replace Maggie, which presents Clara with an opportunity to make a fresh start. Meanwhile, the boys prepare to headline their first gig, as Michelle tries to figure out if John really likes her.(n)

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
programme.desc: Prequel animated series taking place before giant food started raining down on Swallow Falls, featuring the adventures of scientist Flint Lockwood during his high school years.(n)

programme.title: The Matt Hatter Chronicles
programme.desc: Adventure-comedy series about Matt, an ordinary boy who discovers that his family defends a gateway to a different dimension. Matt, Roxie and Gomez have to contend with two deadly foes - the incendiary Fire Phoenix and the bull-headed Minotaur - as Tenoroc tries to bend the inhabitants of the Enchanted Forest to his will. Even empowered with his incredible jet suit, thanks to Minotaur's nerve-shredding Dread Breath, Matt finds that the greatest enemy is fear itself.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Animated series. A mysterious ancient temple beneath the sea has been hidden for centuries. The Nektons discover it was hidden for a very good reason, and the local sea life protect it at all costs.(n)

programme.title: 4 O'Clock Club: The First Gang
programme.desc: Comedy about two brothers at the same school - one as a pupil, the other as a new teacher. When Nathan's laptop mysteriously breaks down in the middle of a project, Josh is the obvious suspect. Josh dodges the problem by suggesting Nathan borrows a replacement from the terrifying Miss Andress's IT classroom. But when that laptop goes missing, which of the Carter brothers will end up carrying the can?(n)

programme.title: You're Skitting Me
programme.desc: Children's comedy sketch show, poking fun at and parodying TV shows, movies and more.(n)

programme.title: Nicky, Ricky, Dicky & Dawn
programme.desc: Sitcom about quadruplets who battle sibling rivalry at every turn. Ricky takes advantage of his power on the school's news programme, but when the other Quads find out why, they band together to help him achieve his goal.(n)

programme.title: Strange Hill High
programme.desc: Animated series following three friends as they investigate all manner of bizarre and odd occurrences at their inner-city school. In her never-ending quest for popularity, Becky wants to join the cheerleading squad. The stuck-up girls on the squad won't let her but do allow her to become the school mascot. Finding a ratty old rabbit costume in a neglected corner of the locker room, Becky puts it on and soon finds her luck changing - along with the school's luck, too. Good things begin to happen, from winning a game to scoring well on a test. But Becky, Templeton and Mitchell discover that for every piece of good luck the costume has brought, a corresponding piece of bad luck also occurs.(n)

programme.desc: US chat show. Hollywood star Keira Knightley discusses her role in Disney's The Nutcracker and the Four Realms. Kathryn Hahn chats about starring in acclaimed Netflix movie Private Life. Country group Old Dominion perform live.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Terese offers the feuding Roxy and Harlow the use of Piper's old car, but her generous gesture merely serves to make matters worse. Aaron questions Elly, worried that she may end up hurting Chloe. Despite his efforts, however, Chloe and Elly enjoy a romantic date and the fires of passion are well and truly lit.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Robbo offers to track down Jasmine's father, but as her friends help get her ready for their wedding she no longer feels so alone. Bella is waiting for Tommy when Raffy shows up. Tori is anxious about meeting Robbo's parents.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sitcom. When Professor Proton contacts Leonard instead of Sheldon for help, Sheldon turns to another TV scientist, Bill Nye. Also, Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a "girls' night".(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team discover untold tales of explorers around our shores, and far beyond, including a stop-off down under in Australia. In Cornwall, Nick Crane uncovers the most astonishing artistic exploration of Britain's coast. Mark Horton reveals the remarkable story of explorer and adventurer Lachlan Macquarie. Born on a tiny Scottish Isle two centuries ago, he went on to establish the country he named Australia. Tessa Dunlop investigates the hidden history of the Pilgrim Fathers. Why did the Pilgrims flee Britain to live in Holland for ten years before their eventual voyage to found modern America? Andy Torbet teams up with scientific explorers trying to crack an age-old puzzle - how can the number of fish in the sea be counted? Plus the struggles of modern-day explorers competing in an extraordinary race to row around the British Isles.(n)

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A hundred years after the Russian Revolution, Simon Reeve embarks on the first leg of an extraordinary three-part journey across Russia. Setting out amongst the active, snow-capped volcanoes of Kamchatka, over 4,000 miles from Moscow, Simon explores one of the remotest regions of the country. The population of Russia's far east has fallen dramatically in recent years, but travelling by chopper and skidoo, Simon finds indigenous reindeer herders who are still eking out a fragile existence. In the port city of Vladivostok, Simon visits a newly built mega casino, designed to attract high rollers and tourists from neighbouring China. Deep in the forest, Simon meets the inspirational conservationist who has created a sanctuary for the country's most iconic predator, the giant Amur tiger. Simon ends his journey on the rim of a giant crater that has emerged in the Siberian landscape - chilling evidence of the impact of global climate change.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a hard-working and ambitious wedding planner whose highly organised life changes when she quite literally falls for her top client's fiance. When she is saved from a potential accident by a handsome young doctor, the two share a romantic evening, but it soon transpires that he is engaged to one of her major clients. Will he choose the wedding planner over his tycoon bride-to-be?(n)

programme.title: Bruce Willis' The Prince
programme.desc: Action thriller. A retired assassin is forced back into action when his daughter is kidnapped by his former rival.(n)

programme.title: Transformation Street
programme.desc: Documentary series focusing on people swapping gender. In this episode, cameras follow 52-year-old virgin Emma as she prepares for breast augmentation, and writer Juno, who grew up believing she was a gay man. Ex-firefighter Stephanie undergoes facial surgery, and we see her attempts to re-establish contact with her family.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a farmer is found horribly murdered in the middle of a stone circle, suspicion points at a group of druids. DCI John Barnaby and DS Jones hurry to the scene of the crime, where they are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding on her first assignment. Druid high priest Leticia Clifford shows Barnaby that sacred ley lines run through the stone circle and later is convinced she has made an exciting discovery. But before she can share her theory, she is stabbed to death. When a third body is found, Barnaby starts to believe that basic human greed - rather than spiritualism - is the real motive for murder.(n)

programme.title: Luke Thomas and the Swing Cats Live
programme.desc: A performance by the Swing Cats, a six-piece band featuring drums, double bass, piano, saxophone, trumpet, and charismatic Irish singer Luke Thomas on lead vocals. Featuring guest performances by Adele King and Paul Harrington.(n)

programme.title: France 24
programme.desc: Cainéal nuachta 24 uair an chloig na Fraince atá in France 24. Bíonn an clár á chraoladh beo as Páras. (France 24 is France's 24-hour international news channel, characterised by respect for diversity and attention to political and cultural differences and identities. Presented live from Paris, the channel has 180 staff journalists and correspondents all over the world).(n)

programme.title: Dúiche

Síle visits the Beara Peninsula in south west Cork. She gets a first hand view of mussel production, and spends the day helping John Harrington prepare his mussels for export to the European markets. Kush Shellfish is a family-run Irish seafood business based in Ardgroom on the scenic south-west coast of Ireland. Established in 1987 by brothers John and Flor Harrington, the company has built an excellent reputation for premium Irish shellfish).(n)

Thirty delegations from around the world are arriving for the Olympics, the red carpet is rolled out five times a day for heads of state, and Noma - ranked the world's number one restaurant - is setting up as a pop-up in the ballroom. With the kitchen stuffed with hay and wood sorrel, Claridge's chefs are faced with turning their backs on the traditional fare to provide Nordic foraged food to thousands of guests who have paid £195 per head to sample, among other delights, live ants. programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: With his 1913 guidebook in hand and clad in a luminous pink jacket, improbable Bohemian Michael Portillo explores the stunning art nouveau architecture of the Czech capital. In a café popular with artists of the time he discovers the dance craze of the day - the tango - and gamely gives it a go. In the spa of kings, Marienbad, now known as Marianske Lazne, Michael samples the sulphurous waters and wallows in peat and mud. At the Skoda factory in Pilsen he investigates how the machine products of peacetime gave way to the manufacture of armaments for war and test drives a state of the art passenger train locomotive made there today. Crossing the border from Bohemia to Bavaria, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald and in Nuremberg he rides German railway history - made in Britain. Arriving in Munich, he discovers an early 20th century pioneer who laid the foundations for the city's pre-eminence in science and technology today.(n)

To start, Simon joins a Donegal family as they swap their cars for bikes for a full week of school runs, commutes and shopping. Meanwhile, Bláthnaid heads to the bike-Mecca of Copenhagen, to see why cycling works so well in Northern Europe and what can be learned from it.(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: Biopic chronicling the three-month period in 1965 which saw Dr Martin Luther King Jr lead a march from Selma to Montgomery. Despite the passing of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 which outlawed segregation, many black people still found they were being denied fundamental rights. In the face of extreme opposition from many who were determined to undermine their efforts, King and his fellow campaigners endured damaging smears and shocking physical attacks on the path to securing equal voting rights.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: All bets are on Fang and Keo, the two fearsome Cuban crocodiles who have just taken up residence at the park. Ben Fogle and Kate Humble reveal how the crocs' cousins in the wild are known for their leaping prowess, propelling themselves out of the water to reach heights of two metres to snatch prey from overhanging branches. But which of the two girls in Animal Adventure has got what it takes to mimic this behaviour? Fang is the stronger of the two. Keo might be weaker, but what she lacks in brawn, she makes up for in brain. Let battle commence. Kate discovers you need nerves of steel, the concentration of a fighter pilot and eyes in the back of your head to patrol the big cats. She doesn't get off to the best of starts on a specially designed learner course. But when she's let loose among the lions, tigers and cheetahs, can she hold her nerve - especially on feed-up day when these ferocious and unpredictable felines are far from patient and don't think twice about taking a swipe at anything that gets between them and their meat. Jean Johansson meets the cousins of the koalas. While the furball marsupials went up trees, wombats stayed on the ground. She discovers how the park's duo of hairy-nosed wombats, the only ones of their kind in Europe, have in-built armour to deter predators. But suddenly tragedy unexpectedly strikes.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom

They can't avoid them, so the team has decided to embrace the construction with a roadworks-themed Bloom entry. They aim to fill their windows with planted-up traffic cones and hard hats. At the showcase library gardens, they hope to fill the beds with traffic light-coloured blooms. Finally, they're engaging the wider community to produce bespoke planters to green up the centre. But this community knows all too well that things can go wrong at any time - last year they were hit with a scandal involving slugs that threatened to scupper the whole competition.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Garden renovation series. In Stowmarket, Charlie and the Rich brothers face one of their hardest ever garden rescues as they have to turn a total concrete jungle into a family-friendly back garden. After a career serving all over the world, army veteran Jason, his wife Esther and their four children have finally put down roots, but their garden is little more than a concrete car park. It is the ultimate test for Charlie and the Rich brothers, Harry and David. The couple have a budget of £3,000 to try to create a space where they can enjoy sitting out as a family, enjoying a quiet cup of tea or a family BBQ. The military is a big part of this family's life as Jason was in the army for 23 years, so one specific request is that the garden features some remembrance poppies. Other than that they are happy to leave themselves in the hands of the experts, but what will Charlie and the Rich brothers come up with in the face of such a difficult makeover?(n)

Meanwhile, Father Quinn is back from rehab, but with Agnes having trouble with a mobile phone, how long will it be before he goes back in?(n)

And after a distressed dementia patient escapes her care home to report a murder, the team look into the disappearance of a policeman, possibly murdered but missing since 1956...(n)

programme.title: Our Cops in the North

programme.title: This is BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Today's reds and blues are bargain hunting at Gloucester antiques centre with the help of experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell. As usual they have one hour to spend £300 on three items to take to auction. Meanwhile, presenter Eric Knowles meets an Action Man collector to learn more about this much-loved toy.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Red, an Amur tiger, is turning out to be a tearaway teenager with a penchant for chasing and attacking cars. It's a hunting instinct that might run deep in his DNA. But, as Kate Humble and Ben Fogle reveal, this rarest of Longleat's ferocious felines needs to be taught some manners - especially after one encounter with a visitor which was just a little too close for comfort. Keeper Caleb has a reputation for bringing big cats to heel, but has he got what it takes to stop this big bad beautiful boy from running amok? Adorable Preston, a six-banded armadillo, isn't just a big personality. He's a big lad too - a bit too big for his own health. Porky Preston needs some help. As Kate turns personal trainer, can she him help with a fitness routine to burn off the flab and get an armadillo six-pack a prospective Mrs P couldn't fail but to admire?Ben is with Viscountess Weymouth to discover how the park is at the helm of a special conservation mission to save the rare Desertas wolf spider. Critically endangered and only found in one remote valley in Madeira, numbers have tumbled to around just 4,000. They need all the help they can get. We meet the stunning Chilean flamingos as they spread their wings after being kept indoors when winter snow afflicted their aviary. With the help of keepers acting as air traffic controllers, no feathers are ruffled, and both lift off and landing are as smooth as can be.And Jean Johansson is planning some monkey business to keep the mischievous macaques out of trouble as she helps with a special pond ladder to test their ingenuity, intelligence and gymnastic prowess.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is not late to grow crops for harvesting this year and Monty shows us how to produce a medley of vegetables from a small space. He also lifts and divides irises plus adds spires of summer colour to his borders.Carol Klein is inspired by the summer planting at Wollerton Old Hall in Shropshire and Frances Tophill travels to the Isle of Man to visit an allotment where plants are grown and harvested as ingredients for cosmetics.Nick Bailey is at RHS Harlow Carr, revelling in their stream-side planting, and Adam Frost is in Northamptonshire, finding out about the design and planting at Cottesbrooke Hall. And the programme meets a woman whose passion for bees is inspiring young beekeepers at a school in Huddersfield.(n)

programme.title: BBC News at Nine
programme.desc: The BBC News at Nine with in-depth discussion and analysis as well as breaking news.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Original stories, exclusive interviews, audience debate and breaking news.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: Stay up to date on the day's top stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Join Kate Humble in this quiz show all about the wonders of the animal kingdom. Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by zoologist and presenter Ferne Corrigan and naturalist and conservationist Iolo Williams.(n)

programme.title: Getting the Builders In
programme.desc: Three pairs of builders go head to head, pricing up jobs and offering designs, and the homeowners choose which team to go with. In Battersea, London, first-time buyer Sam wants to get the builders in to transform his tired kitchen. After hearing three very different pitches, he must pick his favourite. Martin and Mick offer up an industrial coffee shop look with new tiles, new worktop, floor and industrial light. Wayne and Steph go for black tiles and sink with a smart oak worktop, and Gavin and Jimbo offer a dark and mysterious look. Sam has got £3,000 to spend, so who will he get to do the job? In Stretford, Greater Manchester, Elizabeth and Sean need builders to repair a DIY bodge job on their fireplace. Sian and Jon offer a bespoke steel mantel and geometric tile centrepiece. Alex and Chris suggest a reclaimed oak mantel, matching shelves and storage. Tracy and Daz are planning to replaster and repaint the entire wall and use York stone for the hearth, but who will they pick?(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott guides Len Goodman on a culinary road trip around Britain. The pair hit south London, where Len has his first taste of Portuguese and Japanese cuisine. Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouthwatering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: The bikers continue their culinary journey through time as they celebrate British food. The duo explore how Britain's love affair with takeaway food has evolved and cook some of their favourites in the Best of British kitchen.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Series following the lives of rural vets as they treat all creatures great and small. In Teesdale, equine vet Sybil battles with a highland cow in order to treat some Fell ponies, while vet Steve turns dog competition judge at the local Bowes Agricultural Show. And at Fife's small animal hospital, vet Angela has to break some bad news when a rottweiler's suspected broken toenail is not what it first seems.(n)

programme.title: Ingenious Animals
programme.desc: A team of wildlife experts travel the globe in search of the most surprising animal stories and reveal how and why animals do such remarkable things. This episode explores the anatomical secrets of some of the most fascinating animals on the planet. Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is in the French Alps to find out how one man's understanding of an eagle's abilities could help him save it from extinction. Giles Clark is in Australia meeting a kangaroo that is more at home climbing in the trees than hopping through the outback. Giles is also in Kenya, looking at how hippos could be the life force of African river systems. Lucy Cooke is in Costa Rica to find out if the sloth's laziness is the key to its success, and in the UK she meets the scientists who have been investigating how sea lions catche their prey in the dark. Patrick Aryee discovers how a fox with supersensitive hearing can thrive in one of the harshest habitats on Earth, and Shanta Barley reveals the secrets of the platypus.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts travel across the country, competing to make a profit at auction. It's the final outing for Philip Serrell and Louise Gostelow. They've ended up in Sussex, and their classic car in pointed towards that last auction in Brighton. Louise ends up in a beret and, with brush in hand, recreates a very old form of English art. Meanwhile, dog lover Phil shows some serious cat-titude when he ends up learning about the history of some the country's favourite felines. At the last auction it's the battle of the dogs. Which will attract the biggest bid - Phil's silver boxer or Louise's bronze puppy? And who will be crowned champion road tripper?(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Celebrity special of the general knowledge quiz.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: In the last episode of this new series, three entrepreneurs come together to discover what our customers think of their precious products. Jennifer, Muhammad and Craig are all hoping to get a high score from our customers to become today's winner. Jennifer's invention was inspired by her own messy baby. From feeding at home to eating out, her baby always left the highchair and everything around her full of mess. Jennifer has created a bib and tray set which aims to stop messy mealtimes from now on. Muhammad's product was created after a robbery when he was a child left him without his favourite toy. His idea is to create a range of household items with concealed units to store valuables. His mirror is a prototype and is currently undergoing final stages of manufacture. Marine biologist Craig loves nothing more than seaweed. So much so that he's built his business on it. He has developed and created a range of cooking and dressing oils infused with Scottish seaweed.(n)

programme.title: Monkman & Seagull's Genius Guide to Britain
programme.desc: University Challenge icons and real-life best friends Eric Monkman and Bobby Seagull visit Scotland, England, Northern Ireland and Wales in search of hidden gems of British scientific and technological ingenuity. This second episode, their 'genius guide' to Wales, has a strong industrial engineering flavour. Monkman and Seagull begin by sailing across the highest navigable aqueduct in the world - Pontcysyllte Aqueduct.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so he and Paul set off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement for this special trip. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat, and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They discuss luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives. They stay in the heart of the highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and they set off for a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. As the sun sets they reflect on their dreams - did they come true on this trip?(n)

My Land, the Hungarian show that was top rated of all the shows at Edinburgh last year, lets Nish behind the scenes to see them on the high wires pushing the boundary of what the human body is capable of. programme.desc: When a farmer is found horribly murdered in the middle of a stone circle, suspicion points at a group of druids. DCI John Barnaby and DS Jones hurry to the scene of the crime, where they are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding on her first assignment. Druid high priest Leticia Clifford shows Barnaby that sacred ley lines run through the stone circle and later is convinced she has made an exciting discovery. But before she can share her theory, she is stabbed to death. When a third body is found, Barnaby starts to believe that basic human greed - rather than spiritualism - is the real motive for murder.(n)

programme.desc: Comedy series following a hapless 30-year-old as she tries to navigate her way through life with the help of her friends and a life coach. Marcella goes to stay at Simon's grandmother's country cottage where she calls Jon to confess about her lie. Jon visits Marcella's flat to try and find out more. programme.desc: Sci-fi drama series in which a team of soldiers and scientists travels through a portal to discover alien worlds beyond. A Jaffa priestess claims to have knowledge that could destroy the Goa'uld.(n)

programme.desc: Sci-fi drama series. SG-1 fear they may have fallen victim to an untraceable Goa'uld method of mind control when someone from another SG team makes an assassination attempt on the leader of the Tok'ra and then kills himself, apparently unwillingly.(n)

programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series following the 999 work of Greater Manchester Police, who are responsible for protecting 2.7 million people. The team battle to keep the peace on the streets when two warring parties come to blows.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross hopes not to 'see Naples and die' as he gains unprecedented access to the crime underworld of the Camorra, investigating a street war that has claimed more than 4,000 lives in the Italian city.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp reports from the world's most dangerous locations. Ross heads deep into Madagascar's bandit lands as he investigates how organised and murderous cattle rustling gangs have villagers living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Police Force: Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series joining police forces across Australia as they deal with everything from dramatic siege situations, major drug busts and murder investigations.(n)

programme.title: Police Force: Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series joining police forces across Australia as they deal with everything from dramatic siege situations, major drug busts and murder investigations.(n)

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: US drama series. Special agents Maggie Bell and OA Zidan investigate the mysterious murders of 18 young women, with help from a survivor associated with the deceased.(n)

programme.title: Unsung Heroines: Danielle de Niese on the Lost World of Female Composers
programme.desc: Documentary which takes a look at five female composers - from the Middle Ages to the late 20th century - who were famous in their lifetimes, but whose work was then forgotten. Danielle de Niese explores the lives and works of Hildegard of Bingen, Francesca Caccini, Clara Schumann, Florence Price and Elizabeth Maconchy. These women all battled to fulfil their ambitions and overcome the obstacles that society placed in their way. They then disappeared into obscurity, and only some have found recognition again.(n)

programme.title: A Brief History of Graffiti
programme.desc: Dr Richard Clay goes in search of what it is that has made us scribble and scratch mementoes of our lives for more than 30,000 years. From the prehistoric cave paintings of Burgundy in France, through gladiatorial fan worship in Roman Lyons to the messages left on the walls of Germany's Reichstag in 1945 by triumphant Soviet troops, time and again we have wanted to leave a permanent record of our existence for our descendants. And it may be that this is where what today we call art comes from - the humble scratch, graffiti.(n)

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Three-part series in which Helen Czerski explores the science of temperature. Helen explores the narrow band of temperature that has led to life on Earth. She reveals how life began in a dramatic place where hot meets cold, and how every single living creature on Earth depends on temperature for its survival. She uncovers the extraordinary natural engineering that animals have evolved to keep their bodies at the right temperature. And she witnesses the remarkable surgery that's using temperature to push the human body to the very brink of life.(n)

programme.title: This is BBC Four
programme.desc: This is BBC Four. Programmes start at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: This is BBC Four
programme.desc: This is BBC Four. Programmes start at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The latest news, exploring the day's events from a global perspective.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms: Pappano and the National Youth Orchestra of the USA
programme.desc: Suzy Klein introduces America's most talented young musicians in an ambitious concert from the National Youth Orchestra of the USA. Sir Antonio Pappano conducts the UK premiere of Benjamin Beckman's new work, Occidentalis and mezzo Joyce DiDonato sings Berlioz's beautifully crafted miniatures Les nuits d'été. The impressive programme culminates with Richard Strauss's epic work, An Alpine Symphony.(n)

programme.title: TOTP 1988
programme.desc: Mike Read and Simon Mayo present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 12 May 1988 and featuring Harry Enfield, Prince, the Adventures, Narada, Liverpool FC, Belinda Carlisle, Derek B, Prefab Sprout, Star Turn On 45 Pints, Wet Wet Wet, Fairground Attraction and Kylie Minogue.(n)

programme.title: Woodstock - Three Days that Defined a Generation
programme.desc: For three days in August 1969, half a million people from all walks of life converged on a small dairy farm in upstate New York. They came to hear the concert of their lives, but most experienced something far more profound: a moment that came to define a cultural revolution. This documentary tells the story of the lead-up to those three historic days, through the voices of those who were there and the music of the time. It includes extraordinary moments from the concert itself, iconic images of both performers and festival goers, and tells how this groundbreaking event, pulled off right at the last minute, nearly ended in disaster and put the ideals of the counterculture to the test.(n)

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix: The Road to Woodstock
programme.desc: The definitive documentary record of one of Jimi Hendrix's most celebrated performances, now digitally remastered and featuring footage never seen on television before. It includes such signature songs as Purple Haze, Voodoo Child (Slight Return) and his rendition of the Star Spangled Banner, as well as interviews with Woodstock promoter Michael Lang and Hendrix band members Mitch Mitchell, Billy Cox, Larry Lee and Juma Sultan among others.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Series following vet Noel Fitzpatrick and his team in one of the most advanced veterinary practices in Britain. A labrador puppy has an elbow disease that might be helped by fitted plates and stem cell injections. A couple travel down from County Durham with their Russian back terrier, who has been diagnosed with a cancerous growth and is at risk of losing a leg. A one-year-old cat is brought in suffering from a crushed pelvis and a broken tail after a road traffic accident.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary series revealing the secret lives of animals at Chester Zoo. The zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins are being brought up apart from the main colony until they are old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They are keen to join the adults, but when they are finally free to go they have other ideas. Niall the chimp keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years and has developed a special relationship with him. When Boris captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use all his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage. Sunda gharial crocodile François recently arrived at Chester from France along with his partner François, who is turning his snout up at British food. The team hope to kindle a spark between Bornean river turtles Raja and Aris by bringing them together in a new enclosure.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt with more food investigations. Is it worth spending more money on standard products over value ones in the supermarket? In Australia, Kate explores the rising trend for camel milk and asks how you milk one of the grumpiest animals on the planet. And Jimmy finds out the secret behind why supermarket fresh pasta lasts so long.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present more of their favourite food investigations. Matt Tebbutt visits Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are expensive. He visits one of Europe's biggest pesto producers and takes a remarkable trip an underwater basil farm at the bottom of the Mediterranean Sea. As sea temperatures change, could squid and chips one day replace fish and chips as our national dish? To see what could be in store, Jimmy Doherty visits Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. He joins the Thai squid fishing fleet to witness a colourful display of night fishing that's so spectacular it can be seen from space.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt with more food investigations. Jimmy Doherty visits Germany to learn how the humble spud is turned into the unusual shapes in your favourite bag of crisps. Dr Helen Lawal investigates whether carb-restrictive diets really burn fat quicker, and uncovers an astonishing medical use for this popular weight-loss tool. And Matt finds out the surprising reason why smoked fish is dyed yellow.(n)

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: There is never a dull moment with model, businesswoman and celebrity Katie Price! This is an access-all-areas pass into her life with family and friends, at work and at play. As Katie recovers from surgery, her house is next in line for a makeover. Also, her fertility consultation puts her relationship with Kris to the test.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Dr Sandra Lee is one of the most famous dermatologists in America. Barbara's back lump became more noticeable after she lost 131 pounds. Hilda's depression is a result of the multitude of bumps on her eyelids.(n)

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Mom's Not On The Guest List
programme.desc: Reality series revealing the inner workings of the world's premier bridal salon, Kleinfeld Bridal. Kayla wants her family's help to find a dress, but they are not invited to the wedding. Plus, Dori's mum and grandmother want her to wear their heirloom.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and the team look back over another week's events.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The BAFTA-nominated Live at the Apollo presents the best of British stand-up comedy, as Michael McIntyre introduces Rich Hall and Rhod Gilbert at the Hammersmith Apollo, London.(n)

programme.title: Dave Gorman Modern Life is Goodish
programme.sub-title: Just Chips That Haven't Been Made Yet
programme.desc: A series of stand-up shows by comedian Dave Gorman in which he takes an alternative view of modern life. Dave considers celebrity endorsements and reveals the Queen's 'thoughts' on insoles.(n)

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle dream up spectacular stunts for athletes to undertake in different locations around the UK. Tim and Gendle devise a game of 'human hole in one', replacing golf balls with bikes, clubs with a selection of ramps and taking the action to a lake littered with targets.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.(n)

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality series following custom car manufacturer Steve Darnell, who kits out vehicles for a range of clients using only junk. A client who works in the demolitions trade wants his vehicle to fit his image, so the team get to work on a pickup truck.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Reality series following a team of skilled antiques pickers as they scour junk piles, garages, attics and barns for hidden gems. The guys explore a stash of ultra-rare motorcycle parts found behind a secret wall. Later, they find a propeller linked to Charles Lindbergh.(n)

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: British version of the reality show that follows a group of auction experts who compete for disused storage. New bidder Raj is proving to be more than a match for our regulars. Boudicca, Scotty, Thomas and Nat doubt that Sam knows what she is talking about.(n)

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: British version of the reality show that follows a group of auction experts who compete for disused storage. The auctioneers are in Royston, Hertfordshire. Heavy D drives everyone else round the bend, including Sean Kelly. Charlotte and Shaun, Nat and John and new bidder Mick have their expertise tested. Linda shows her spiritual side. Scotty proves he has hidden talents.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Reality series following a team of skilled antiques pickers as they scour junk piles, garages, attics and barns for hidden gems. Mike and Frank look for treasures on a unique homestead, but the handyman who owns it drives a hard bargain.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Reality series following a team of skilled antiques pickers as they scour junk piles, garages, attics and barns for hidden gems. In Detroit, Frank takes a big risk. Meanwhile, Mike acquires a Purple Heart.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Reality series following a team of skilled antiques pickers as they scour junk piles, garages, attics and barns for hidden gems. Mike and Frank pick the Big Apple, getting to the core of a New York computer store with a huge stockpile of equipment. Will they byte?(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring magazine presented by Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May. The guys hand over duties to their mothers to review a range of new small cars including the Renault Modus, Honda Jazz and Peugeot 1007; Jeremy returns to the 1960s to define cool, with the Aston Martin DB5 and Jaguar E-type and Richard Hammond tests the new BMW 3 Series. This week's Star in a Reasonably Priced Car is Omid Djalili.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of Staffordshire Police. A group of travellers take exception to the cops enforcing a high court writ on them. When told they can't relocate their caravans to an adjoining piece of land, tempers fray and a violent confrontation looms. In Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, undercover bodycam cops raid a suspected drug dealer and make an astonishing discovery, thousands of pounds' worth of drugs in a freezer disguised as ice cream. And, late on a Saturday night in Burton upon Trent, CCTV cameras capture a man throwing a a chair at a woman in the town centre.(n)

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Reality series following the car customiser to the stars, Yianni Charalambous, the man the rich and famous trust with their precious rides. A flamboyant property developer with a taste for cars - and gold - wants his AMG Mercedes C63 wrapped in the chrome shiny stuff.(n)

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Reality series following the car customiser to the stars, Yianni Charalambous, the man the rich and famous trust with their precious rides. 'G' is a fussy guy, so when he chooses an unusual nardo grey colour for his Ferrari wrap, everyone is on edge.(n)

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: A series following three best friends engaged in the world of international car 'flipping' - where cars are quickly resold for profit in Lincolnshire. The team rely on social media and a network of international fixers to aid them in their hunt for valuable vehicles. In this episode, Jonny thinks he can turn a profit on the relatively unknown Seat 600 and purchases one from Barcelona, as the Lazy Boys try to tap into the market for bubble cars.(n)

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: A series following three best friends engaged in the world of international car 'flipping' - where cars are quickly resold for profit in Lincolnshire. The team rely on social media and a network of international fixers to aid them in their hunt for valuable vehicles. In this episode, Jonny Smith finds an Austrian Ford Cortina Mk4, known in Europe as the Taunus, but the Lazy Boys need to decide whether to replace its rare engine.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring magazine presented by Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May. Jeremy comes under fire from army snipers to find out which car is better - the Porsche Boxster S or Mercedes SLK. James road tests the Murano, a new 4x4 from Nissan and Richard finds out if the Maserati GranSport is better than the previous coupe. This week's 'Star in a Reasonably Priced Car' is Damon Hill.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring magazine presented by Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May. An epic race from London to Oslo with Jeremy in the Mercedes McLaren SLR and Richard and James on a boat. This week's Star in a Reasonably Priced Car is David Dimbleby and there's another chance to vote for the favourite driving song of all time.(n)

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Russell Howard invents sticky tape architecture, Tim Vine attempts a risky impersonation and Liza Tarbuck gifts Alex Horne a big, messy cake. In the season finale, the recipient of the Taskamster's shiny golden bonce is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended version of the satirical news quiz. Regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop are joined by guest host Ed Balls and guest panellists Janet Street-Porter and Henning Wehn.(n)

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Medical sitcom about the unseen world of hospitals. Newbie hospital porter Simon arrives for work on his first day. To the great amusement of his mentors Frankie and Tillman, he thinks portering is just a stepping-stone to his true calling in life - being a doctor. A mix-up with a dead rabbi means Simon is forced to impersonate a real doctor and somehow escape the suspicious scrutiny of a visiting consultant neurologist.(n)

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Medical sitcom about the unseen world of hospitals. Newbie porter Simon is still coping with his unrequited love for nurse Lucy. Seeing her swoon over the heroic Doctor McKenzie prompts Simon to impulsively offer a kidney to a young transplant patient called Lewis. When Frankie steals a recently deceased patient's winning lottery ticket, Tillman warns that karma will be out to rebalance the universe - and it looks like Simon will have to pay the price.(n)

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Sitcom about flatmates Josh, Kate and Owen, and their annoying landlord Geoff. It's Josh's birthday, so Kate and Owen decide to organise him a fancy-dress party. Josh is not keen, but relents in the hope that it might give him a chance with Lucy who lives upstairs. Meanwhile, Kate meets her ex-boyfriend's new girlfriend Cath, who is obsessed with YouTube videos and will not be deterred by either lack of interest or buffering. And, inevitably, Geoff pops by the party wearing a suitably impractical costume.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series following the US navy's dedicated federal agency. Ziva and Tony grow closer as they go undercover to investigate the murder of two hired assassins.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series about an investigative team connected to the US navy. After McGee kills a man in the line of duty, he discovers that his victim is an undercover police officer. Jenny sanctions an inquiry, forcing the team to prove that McGee was not culpable and straining relationships all round.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Powerful American drama about the investigation and prosecution of crime. A female veteran of the second Gulf War is found murdered, and the evidence points to the sister of a former inmate of Abu Ghraib prison. When DAs McCoy and Southerlyn begin to prosecute, however, they discover that the suspect's lawyer plans to defend his client as an enemy combatant, and subject only to the terms of the Geneva Convention.(n)

programme.title: Sea Patrol
programme.desc: Drama series about the work of the Royal Australian Navy Patrol Boat Service. Things take a surprising turn when Ryan joins a private security firm, only to find out they may not be as law abiding as they claim.(n)

programme.desc: Female investigators reveal details of some of the most daunting cases they have faced. Just months from their 25th wedding anniversary, a gentle Toronto couple are found brutally murdered for no apparent reason.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Drama series about a team of forensic investigators. A decorated US Marine Corps recruiter is found dead at a civilian shooting range, but appears to have been killed by a blow to the head.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Crime series. A prison guard is charged with the cold-blooded murder of an ex-convict who threatened his family. The officer makes a radical plea of self-defence in a bid to sway the jury.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Crime drama series. Two college students jump to their deaths, and Detectives Fontana and Green discover that both were taking part in a secret testing program for a new anti-depressant - a programme that has resulted in several suicides and attempted suicides. ADA McCoy pursues the CEO of the pharmaceutical firm for second-degree murder.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Crime drama series. Two undercover police officers are killed during a firearms sting and it emerges that their photographs had been posted on a website - alerting criminals to their identity. The website's backer believes he is protected under the First Amendment, but McCoy senses a more sinister motive at work.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Crime drama. A famous novelist dies from complications following plastic surgery. Evidence emerges that her surgeon made a crucial mistake and then ignored her pleas for help - but McCoy is reluctant to prosecute him.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series following the US navy's dedicated federal agency. During the filming of a reality TV show at a marine base, a supermodel is murdered. The investigation reveals three immediate suspects, all of whom are implicated by their romantic interest in the woman.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series about an investigative team connected to the US navy. Tony and Ziva disappear while searching for smuggled weapons at a shipyard. Abby draws a blank when she tries tracking them via their GPS chips.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series following a team who investigate crimes connected to the US navy. The commander in charge of a shipment of nuclear weapons is kidnapped, and the team must find him before he divulges its secret location.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Drama series following the US navy's dedicated federal agency. When an ambulance carrying the body of a dead marine explodes, the agents uncover evidence of subterfuge that leads them to suspect that the marine's family has something to hide.(n)

programme.title: Major Crimes
programme.desc: Crime series following the cases of Captain Raydor and her team. Lieutenant Provenza arranges for more resources to assist the team in apprehending Stroh. Meanwhile, Rusty discovers an important evidence.(n)

programme.title: Murder in Paradise
programme.desc: Crime series exploring horrific murders in dream destinations. A look at the conspiracy of revenge and torture that surrounded the disappearance of private investigator Rick Post in South Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Murder She Solved
programme.desc: Female investigators and forensics reveal some of the most daunting cases they have faced and the challenges that have stood in the way of catching some of the most notorious killers. When a man is bludgeoned to death, his wife and daughter are suspected of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Rescue: Code One
programme.desc: Documentary series following a group of highly-trained paramedics as they patrol the coast and skies of New Zealand, racing to the scenes of life-or-death situations. In this edition, the team rush to the rescue of a young boy who has crashed on a dirt bike, and a mother whose vehicle has careered off the road and down a hill.(n)

programme.title: Rescue: Code One
programme.desc: Documentary series following a group of highly-trained paramedics as they patrol the coast and skies of New Zealand, racing to the scenes of life-or-death situations. The team are summoned to help a girl who has been hit by a car whilst riding her bike, and a camper who has been burned by an exploding gas canister.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Drama series about a team of forensic investigators. A decorated US Marine Corps recruiter is found dead at a civilian shooting range, but appears to have been killed by a blow to the head.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Drama series following the FBI's Behavioural Analysis Unit as they attempt to solve crimes through psychological profiling. In Dallas, the BAU search for a serial killer who ensnares businessmen by posing as a call girl.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Series following Thames Valley police's proactive squad, providing an insight into car crime. Video footage also shows examples of dangerous drivers in the UK and the US.(n)

programme.title: Brit Cops: Frontline Crime
programme.desc: Action-packed documentary series following Britain's police as they battle to protect the public from the most dangerous and persistent offenders in the country. The cameras follow high-speed reaction units and armed response teams whose job it is to keep tabs on home-grown crooks and the growing threat posed by criminals from abroad. This programme shadows police teams from Wales.(n)

programme.title: Ireland's Paramedics
programme.desc: Documentary series. Waterford paramedic Joe Winters and his nephew, advanced paramedic Derek Burke, respond to a call concerning a possible drowning victim. In Dublin, an ambulance cannot get past a locked barrier when trying to attend an incident in a park involving a serious injury. Also, a panicked mother calls 999 when her son takes a heroin overdose.(n)

programme.title: The Real A&E

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules Australia
programme.desc: Cooking competition. Tensions flare and battle lines are drawn as the final Top 8 positions are up for grabs. Who stays and who goes?(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Drama series following the FBI's Behavioural Analysis Unit as they attempt to solve crimes through psychological profiling. The team investigates a series of murders involving exorcism, apparently sanctioned by the Vatican.(n)

programme.title: Instinct
programme.desc: Drama series. Dylan and Lizzie are baffled as to the motives of seemingly average people who become suicide bombers. Contains distressing scenes.(n)

programme.title: Instinct
programme.desc: Crime drama series. Dylan and Lizzie investigate the murder of a film student whose death was screened for the audience.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Crime drama series following the FBI's Behavioural Analysis Unit as they attempt to solve crimes through psychological profiling. The landmark 150th episode of the popular crime drama sees the BAU team travel to Houston to search for a serial rapist who is assaulting his past victims.(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: US animated comedy series. Francine becomes less attracted to Stan when he gets involved with slot car racing, and Roger becomes a stewardess to perform comedy routines on the plane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: US animated comedy series. Steve and his friends take up witchcraft to gain power and popularity at school. Stan and Klaus become obsessed with remembering 90s bands.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about family life. When a 'wardrobe malfunction' occurs during a live broadcast, the Federal Communications Commission begins to censor Peter's favourite television shows. As a result, Peter creates his own TV station which broadcasts from the Griffin home. Peter and Brian create their own edgy programming for the station, until the FCC shows up to shut down PTV and censor all controversial material in Quahog.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about family life. After writing a story for a local magazine, Brian lands a job with the prestigious New Yorker. However, his college dropout status haunts him so he decides to go back to Brown University to get his degree. As Brian struggles to pass his class, Stewie enjoys the college lifestyle. Meanwhile, Peter and his friends combine forces to help the city.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Subversive animated comedy about American family life. When Meg finally gathers the courage to ask out her crush Kent, she is devastated to learn he is gay. When Meg discovers that Kent has feelings for Chris, she uses her brother in the worst way to get closer to Kent.(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: US animated comedy series. Stan is upset at the idea of becoming a grandfather after Hayley and Jeff announce they are trying to have a baby. Steve and Klaus join a drug gang after Steve decides to take being an uncle extra seriously.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Crime drama series about a private police consultant with OCD. Monk is finally reinstated as a police detective, and faces his first challenge when he realises that the key witness in a serial killer case may be lying.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Crime drama series about a private police consultant with OCD. In the first part of the series finale, Monk is called back to the paediatric clinic where he first heard the news of his wife's murder. As he investigates the death of a doctor who may be connected to Trudy's death, Monk's own life comes under threat as he pieces together the past in his most important investigation yet.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Forensic crime drama. When a TV personality is killed, the team go behind the scenes for clues. Bones and Booth disagree about throwing Christine a birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: US legal drama series. Bull is brought on to help the FBI's case against a hacker whom they believe breached air traffic control at LaGuardia Airport.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Crime drama series. Following an active shooter lockdown at a naval hospital, the NCIS team searches for a suspect who fled the scene.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Forensic crime drama. A case of mistaken identity results in an artefact collector attending what is supposedly his own funeral. Brennan steps in to find out what's afoot.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Forensic crime drama. Booth explores whether a lupus patient's use of medical marijuana and job at a drug dispensary could be linked to her four-month disappearance.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Crime drama series following an investigator with uncommon insight and unconventional methods. Jane agrees to pretend to be a renowned psychic and act as bait in an attempt to lure out a serial killer and give the FBI a chance to apprehend him.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Crime drama series. NCIS investigates the murder of a Marine Major, believed to have been killed in the 9/11 attack on the Pentagon, after human remains are discovered at a construction site. A personal history with the victim drives Gibbs to solve her crime.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: US legal drama series. The DA hires Bull to help convict Hazel Diaz, a known crime boss, who has murdered a police officer in broad daylight, but has always managed to avoid jail by pleading that she has a mental illness.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Forensic crime drama. Brennan is flummoxed when a body bears conflicting evidence about the time of death. Booth, meanwhile, has mixed feelings about a new opportunity.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Crime drama series following an investigator with uncommon insight and unconventional methods. Lisbon accepts Jane's surprise marriage proposal, but a killer's quest for revenge may cost them the happy ending they have worked so hard to achieve.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Crime drama series. After entering cold case DNA into the system, Kasie solves a 30-year old murder case, but a loophole in the legal system may set the suspect free. Also, McGee visits an elite technology company in Silicon Valley that is offering him a highly paid position.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Crime drama series. After NCIS finds a secret government bank account that's funding a nationwide network of vigilante justice, the team must determine who is acting as judge and jury.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: US crime drama series. The NCIS team investigates the murder of a Navy contractor who, unbeknownst to anyone, lived two lives for decades, with two wives, families and careers.(n)

programme.title: L.A.'s Finest
programme.desc: Crime drama series. With Dante back in her life, it's impossible for McKenna to keep hiding the truth about her mother's death from Syd.(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: US animated comedy series. Steve becomes the town pariah after he convinces the star quarterback of the arena football team to stop playing.(n)

programme.title: American Dad!

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Father, the Son and the Holy Fonz
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about family life. When Peter's dad visits the Griffins, he tries to impose his religious beliefs on the family. But after a mishap leaves Stewie stuck living in a bubble, Peter searches for a new religion, finding faith in his television hero the Fonz. But the newly established Church of the Fonz struggles to retain its members.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Animated adult comedy following the misadventures of four irreverent school children in the quiet, dysfunctional town of South Park, Colorado. Meanwhile, the pressure of holding on to a giant secret starts to get to Randy.(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: Frankenfood

programme.desc: Fantasy drama. Uther has a precious magical relic of the Old Religion locked up tight in the Camelot vaults. Morgana has always shared a powerful bond with the druid boy, but will she go as far as turning thief and traitor for him? programme.title: Merlin

Upon returning home, they find everyone in a deep, unnatural sleep - all except for Morgana. Could she be behind the sleeping spell affecting the kingdom?(n)

But, as Kate Humble and Ben Fogle reveal, this rarest of Longleat's ferocious felines needs to be taught some manners - especially after one encounter with a visitor which was just a little too close for comfort. Keeper Caleb has a reputation for bringing big cats to heel, but has he got what it takes to stop this big bad beautiful boy from running amok? Adorable Preston, a six-banded armadillo, isn't just a big personality. He's a big lad too - a bit too big for his own health. Porky Preston needs some help. As Kate turns personal trainer, can she him help with a fitness routine to burn off the flab and get an armadillo six-pack a prospective Mrs P couldn't fail but to admire?Ben is with Viscountess Weymouth to discover how the park is at the helm of a special conservation mission to save the rare Desertas wolf spider. Critically endangered and only found in one remote valley in Madeira, numbers have tumbled to around just 4,000. They need all the help they can get. We meet the stunning Chilean flamingos as they spread their wings after being kept indoors when winter snow afflicted their aviary. With the help of keepers acting as air traffic controllers, no feathers are ruffled, and both lift off and landing are as smooth as can be.And Jean Johansson is planning some monkey business to keep the mischievous macaques out of trouble as she helps with a special pond ladder to test their ingenuity, intelligence and gymnastic prowess.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is not late to grow crops for harvesting this year and Monty shows us how to produce a medley of vegetables from a small space. He also lifts and divides irises plus adds spires of summer colour to his borders.Carol Klein is inspired by the summer planting at Wollerton Old Hall in Shropshire and Frances Tophill travels to the Isle of Man to visit an allotment where plants are grown and harvested as ingredients for cosmetics.Nick Bailey is at RHS Harlow Carr, revelling in their stream-side planting, and Adam Frost is in Northamptonshire, finding out about the design and planting at Cottesbrooke Hall. And the programme meets a woman whose passion for bees is inspiring young beekeepers at a school in Huddersfield.(n)

programme.title: BBC News at Nine
programme.desc: The BBC News at Nine with in-depth discussion and analysis as well as breaking news.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Original stories, exclusive interviews, audience debate and breaking news.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: Stay up to date on the day's top stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Join Kate Humble in this quiz show all about the wonders of the animal kingdom. Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by zoologist and presenter Ferne Corrigan and naturalist and conservationist Iolo Williams.(n)

programme.title: Getting the Builders In
programme.desc: Three pairs of builders go head to head, pricing up jobs and offering designs, and the homeowners choose which team to go with. In Battersea, London, first-time buyer Sam wants to get the builders in to transform his tired kitchen. After hearing three very different pitches, he must pick his favourite. Martin and Mick offer up an industrial coffee shop look with new tiles, new worktop, floor and industrial light. Wayne and Steph go for black tiles and sink with a smart oak worktop, and Gavin and Jimbo offer a dark and mysterious look. Sam has got £3,000 to spend, so who will he get to do the job? In Stretford, Greater Manchester, Elizabeth and Sean need builders to repair a DIY bodge job on their fireplace. Sian and Jon offer a bespoke steel mantel and geometric tile centrepiece. Alex and Chris suggest a reclaimed oak mantel, matching shelves and storage. Tracy and Daz are planning to replaster and repaint the entire wall and use York stone for the hearth, but who will they pick?(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott guides Len Goodman on a culinary road trip around Britain. The pair hit south London, where Len has his first taste of Portuguese and Japanese cuisine. Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouthwatering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: The bikers continue their culinary journey through time as they celebrate British food. The duo explore how Britain's love affair with takeaway food has evolved and cook some of their favourites in the Best of British kitchen.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Series following the lives of rural vets as they treat all creatures great and small. In Teesdale, equine vet Sybil battles with a highland cow in order to treat some Fell ponies, while vet Steve turns dog competition judge at the local Bowes Agricultural Show. And at Fife's small animal hospital, vet Angela has to break some bad news when a rottweiler's suspected broken toenail is not what it first seems.(n)

programme.title: Ingenious Animals
programme.desc: A team of wildlife experts travel the globe in search of the most surprising animal stories and reveal how and why animals do such remarkable things. This episode explores the anatomical secrets of some of the most fascinating animals on the planet. Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is in the French Alps to find out how one man's understanding of an eagle's abilities could help him save it from extinction. Giles Clark is in Australia meeting a kangaroo that is more at home climbing in the trees than hopping through the outback. Giles is also in Kenya, looking at how hippos could be the life force of African river systems. Lucy Cooke is in Costa Rica to find out if the sloth's laziness is the key to its success, and in the UK she meets the scientists who have been investigating how sea lions catche their prey in the dark. Patrick Aryee discovers how a fox with supersensitive hearing can thrive in one of the harshest habitats on Earth, and Shanta Barley reveals the secrets of the platypus.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts travel across the country, competing to make a profit at auction. It's the final outing for Philip Serrell and Louise Gostelow. They've ended up in Sussex, and their classic car in pointed towards that last auction in Brighton. Louise ends up in a beret and, with brush in hand, recreates a very old form of English art. Meanwhile, dog lover Phil shows some serious cat-titude when he ends up learning about the history of some the country's favourite felines. At the last auction it's the battle of the dogs. Which will attract the biggest bid - Phil's silver boxer or Louise's bronze puppy? And who will be crowned champion road tripper?(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Celebrity special of the general knowledge quiz.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: In the last episode of this new series, three entrepreneurs come together to discover what our customers think of their precious products. Jennifer, Muhammad and Craig are all hoping to get a high score from our customers to become today's winner. Jennifer's invention was inspired by her own messy baby. From feeding at home to eating out, her baby always left the highchair and everything around her full of mess. Jennifer has created a bib and tray set which aims to stop messy mealtimes from now on. Muhammad's product was created after a robbery when he was a child left him without his favourite toy. His idea is to create a range of household items with concealed units to store valuables. His mirror is a prototype and is currently undergoing final stages of manufacture. Marine biologist Craig loves nothing more than seaweed. So much so that he's built his business on it. He has developed and created a range of cooking and dressing oils infused with Scottish seaweed.(n)

programme.title: Monkman & Seagull's Genius Guide to Britain
programme.desc: University Challenge icons and real-life best friends Eric Monkman and Bobby Seagull visit Scotland, England, Northern Ireland and Wales in search of hidden gems of British scientific and technological ingenuity. This second episode, their 'genius guide' to Wales, has a strong industrial engineering flavour. Monkman and Seagull begin by sailing across the highest navigable aqueduct in the world - Pontcysyllte Aqueduct.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys presents heat two of the classic quiz where contenders take the black chair. Tonight's specialist subjects are the Mughal Empire, the life and legacy of Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, Charles Dickens's female characters and Rod Serling's The Twilight Zone.(n)

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so he and Paul set off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement for this special trip. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat, and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They discuss luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives. They stay in the heart of the highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and they set off for a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. As the sun sets they reflect on their dreams - did they come true on this trip?(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: Fosse/Verdon

He starts on the rehearsals of Pippin. Meanwhile, Gwen is struggling with her first straight play, Children, Children.(n)

programme.desc: Highlights from this year's Edinburgh Festival. For one month in August, Edinburgh is home to brave new ideas, controversy and some of the most innovative comedy, theatre, dance and circus shows from around the world.Nish Kumar goes behind the scenes to sample The Blind Boys of Alabama in a remarkable partnership with Malian duo Amadou and Mariam. My Land, the Hungarian show that was top rated of all the shows at Edinburgh last year, lets Nish behind the scenes to see them on the high wires pushing the boundary of what the human body is capable of. And Nish gets to know some of this year's up-and-coming comedians.(n)

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.sub-title: Queen - A Night at the Opera
programme.desc: Documentary series looking at the creation of some classic rock albums. A Night At The Opera, the fourth Queen album released in late 1975, is a mix of hard rock, pop, opera, music hall camp and traditional folk, utilising multi layered guitars, crunching riffs, vocals harmonies, piano flourishes, a harp, a ukulele and no synthesisers.(n)

programme.title: Discovering: Queen

programme.desc: Documentary series examining important figures in cinema. This edition takes an intimate look at the life and career of John Wayne. Born Marion Morrison, the former football player would go on to become one of the most famous actors of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Discovering: Charlton Heston
programme.desc: Documentary series examining important figures in cinema. In this edition, leading film critics discuss the career of Charlton Heston. After humble beginnings on stage, he took Hollywood by storm as the star of Ben-Hur and Planet of the Apes.(n)

programme.title: Classic Albums: Elvis Presley - Elvis Presley
programme.desc: A look at the creation of Elvis Presley's eponymous debut album, which brought about his meteoric rise to superstardom in 1956. The film is filled with performances from 1955 and 56, interviews with Elvis and rare home movie footage of him at play and work, offering fresh insights into his life and his recordings. Featured songs include Blue Suede Shoes, Shake Rattle and Roll, Tutti Frutti and Elvis's first million-seller, Heartbreak Hotel.(n)

programme.title: Elvis and the Girl from Vienna

programme.title: The Seven Ages of Elvis

Stills, archive film and many musical numbers - including Heartbreak Hotel and Hound Dog - combine to show how a poor 21-year-old from Mississippi changed the face of popular music.(n)

Marcella goes to stay at Simon's grandmother's country cottage where she calls Jon to confess about her lie. Jon visits Marcella's flat to try and find out more. programme.desc: Documentary series revealing the secret lives of animals at Chester Zoo. The zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins are being brought up apart from the main colony until they are old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They are keen to join the adults, but when they are finally free to go they have other ideas. Niall the chimp keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years and has developed a special relationship with him. When Boris captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use all his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage. Sunda gharial crocodile François recently arrived at Chester from France along with his partner François, who is turning his snout up at British food.
